#REMARK SUMMARY
TITLE	Yar1-Rps3 complex from Saccharomyces cerevisiae

BIOISIS_ID	Y1R3DP
EXP_DESCRIPTION	Yar1 is a chaperone of Rps3 and prevents aggreation of Rps3 before its association with 40S ribosomal subunit. Recombinant Yar1-Rps3 complex was studied in solution. Yar1 associates with the N-terminal domain of Rps3 and forms a 2:2 complex. The tetramer is formed by the dimerization of Rps3 by its C-terminal domain.
SOURCE_LOCATION	SOLEIL SYnchrotron, SWING beamline

PUBLICATION	To be published

#REMARK EXPERIMENTAL CONDITIONS
EXPERIMENTAL_DETAILS	SAXS profile was recorded on an in-line HPLC SEC peak (agilent BioSec-3 size-exclusion column run at a flow rate of 200microliter/min). The sample was loaded at 10mg/ml concentration.10 frames (2.5s exposure) corresponding to the peak were averaged.
